issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Job submitted with Delegation token in secured environment causes RM to fail during RM restart

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: In our secure Nightlies we saw exceptions in the RM log where it failed to parse the deletegation token.
fields.summary: YARN RM fails to load state store with delegation token parsing error

{code}/ip to host:8032 failed on connection exception: java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused; For more details see:  http://wiki.apache.org/hadoop/ConnectionRefused
2014-03-23 17:14:49,306 WARN  resourcemanager.RMAppManager (RMAppManager.java:recoverApplication(330)) - Unable to parse and renew delegation tokens.
{code}
This sounds like a blocker. Likely broken by the patch for YARN-1812.

This is due to RMDelegationTokenIdentifier#localServiceAddress is not yet set when application is renewing the local tokens on recovery.
YARN-1107 had a similar issue, where the test case didn't catch this because RMDelegationTokenIdentifier#localServiceAddress is a static field and once it's set in the first RM,  the second RM can also pick up the same value.

Upload  a patch to set the localSecretManager and service address in DelegationTokenRenwer#serviceInit  also.
The patch added a few missing test timeouts in TestRMRestart.

The changes look good to me. +1.

This part of the code keeps breaking despite all the tests. Here's hoping this is the last of the issues.

Will check this in if Jenkins says okay..

Fixed the test failures.
The test failures were due to in the tests, the rmContext is a mock object.  rmContext#getClientRMService()#getBindAddress() throws NPE.
